title: Project Manager
job_overview:
About Us:

We are a start-up international community dedicated to teaching Kabbalistic astrology in a practical, spiritual, and accessible way. We offer courses in multiple languages and work with students from all over the world. Our mission is to deliver high-impact programs and services that empower our communities and clients. We're looking for a proactive and detail-oriented Project Manager to support our team in streamlining operations, improving communication, and ensuring projects are delivered on time and within scope.

Job Summary:
As our Project Manager, you’ll be responsible for planning, executing, and finalizing projects across various departments. You will work closely with our leadership team (including the Admin & Operations Manager and Social Media Manager) to ensure deliverables are met, teaUpgrade to see actual infombers stay aligned, and timelines are respected. You’ll also coordinate between stakeholders, track progress, and implement tools and systems that help us scale.

Key Responsibilities:
Develop and manage project timelines, milestones, and deliverables
Coordinate tasks among cross-functional teams (marketing, design, social media, admin, etc.)
Monitor team productivity and performance, identifying risks or blockers early and prompting the corresponding teaUpgrade to see actual infomber promptly.
Maintain project documentation, reports, and dashboards using tools like Upgrade to see actual info, spreadsheets, or others
Communicate regularly with stakeholders and provide progress updates
Track resources and deliverables where applicable
Support process optimization and documentation
Identify gaps and propose solutions for workflow efficiency
Conduct post-project reviews and create process improvements based on lessons learned

Qualifications:
1+ years of experience in project management, operations, or a similar role
Excellent organizational, multitasking, and time management skills
Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
Experience using project management tools (e.g., ClickUp, Asana, Upgrade to see actual info, Airtable)
Ability to manage multiple projects with overlapping deadlines
Experience working with remote and cross-functional teams
Detail-oriented, solutions-driven, and tech-savvy

Preferred But Not Required:
Experience in astrology, education, or creative industries
Familiarity with tools like Canva, Hubspot, Tilda, Xero
Background in administrative support
A proactive and assertive attitude with a passion for continuous learning and growth

Why Join Us?
Work closely with a supportive and visionary leadership team
Remote-first culture and flexible work environment
Opportunities to grow into a leadership role
Be part of a mission-driven organization that values impact, integrity, and collaboration
